import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd 
from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
from matplotlib import colors as cls
plt.style.use('fivethirtyeight')

%matplotlib inline

source.874ef497:
def second_plot(y2,color2,title=None):
    plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
    
    plt.plot(df['Date'], df['Confirmed'], color='blue', label='Confirmed')
    plt.plot(df['Date'], df[y2], color=color2, label=y2)
    
    plt.title(title)
    plt.xlabel('Dates')
    plt.ylabel('Confirmed Cases')
    plt.legend(loc='upper left')
    plt.show()
source.f8076e42: second_plot('Moving Average','orange','Confirmed vs Simple Moving Average')
source.02f48f59:
weights = np.arange(1,5)
df['Weighted Moving Average'] = df['Confirmed'].rolling(4).apply(lambda confirmed: np.dot(confirmed, weights)/weights.sum(), raw=True)
source.292bc224: second_plot('Weighted Moving Average','Yellow','Confirmed vs Weighted Moving Average')
source.a9d6dd61: second_plot('Exponential Moving Average','red','Confirmed vs Exponential Moving Average')
source.6bce0f07:
colors = ['blue','orange','yellow','red']
i=0
for column in df.columns[1:]:
    plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
    plt.plot(df['Date'], df[column], label=column,color=colors[i])
    plt.title(column)
    i += 1
    plt.legend()
    plt.show()
source.f7a7d27f:
colors = ['blue','orange','yellow','red']
i=0
for column in df.columns[1:]:
    plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
    plt.hist2d(df['Date'], df[column],bins=20, label=column,color=colors[i],cmap='summer',norm=cls.LogNorm())
    plt.title(column)
    i += 1
plt.legend()
plt.show()
